intro: Brachystemum, commonly known as the silver hair grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. These plants are characterized by their fine, silky leaves that often have a silvery or grayish appearance due to the presence of dense, soft hairs. Brachystemum species are typically found in temperate regions and are often associated with moist, well-drained soils. They are low-growing plants that form dense mats, which can help stabilize soil and prevent erosion. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
